channel.title: Comments on: WGW 29: Why I Never Counted

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: The important thing is that you enjoyed it. Ganbatte Marek! Can't wait for you to start studying the Level Up books!
item.content:encoded: The important thing is that you enjoyed it. Ganbatte Marek! Can’t wait for you to start studying the Level Up books!

item.title: By: Marek Jasovsky
item.dc:creator: Marek Jasovsky
item.description: :D well yes, except for the fact, that my mistakes happened probably lot earlier than in endgame. but I have to confess I love the game. there was even one small ko fight there.... threats, etc...
item.content:encoded: ðŸ˜€ well yes, except for the fact, that my mistakes happened probably lot earlier than in endgame. but I have to confess I love the game. there was even one small ko fight there…. threats, etc…

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: Absolutely. And you'll learn more about endgame when you're SDK too. Don't worry for now. A game with only 3.5 points difference is awesome!
item.content:encoded: Absolutely. And you’ll learn more about endgame when you’re SDK too. Don’t worry for now. A game with only 3.5 points difference is awesome!

item.title: By: Marek Jasovsky
item.dc:creator: Marek Jasovsky
item.description: Well, I can give you great example why counting counts ;) of course you will tell me that it will improve with time (books already in country, ETA tomorrow AM CET ;)) ) but yesterday in one rated game played, I was sure I was winning, and at the end I found myself loose by 3.5 moku ;) it is true that I had not that many options towards the end but if I knew I was behind, I would try some forcing moves to reduce opponent territory
item.content:encoded: Well, I can give you great example why counting counts ðŸ˜‰ of course you will tell me that it will improve with time (books already in country, ETA tomorrow AM CET ;)) ) but yesterday in one rated game played, I was sure I was winning, and at the end I found myself loose by 3.5 moku ðŸ˜‰ it is true that I had not that many options towards the end but if I knew I was behind, I would try some forcing moves to reduce opponent territory

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: Agreed. I think over time, I decided that increasing my lead as much as possible was the best route. Haha. Bad decision. =)
item.content:encoded: Agreed. I think over time, I decided that increasing my lead as much as possible was the best route. Haha. Bad decision. =)

item.title: By: sleberle
item.dc:creator: sleberle
item.description: I also tend to avoid counting. I just finished reading Attack and Defense by Ishida and Davies. One thing that I learned is that when you're behind, it's time to make a risky, daring attack; when you're ahead, it's time to defensively solidify your lead. So I guess estimating the score is important.
item.content:encoded: I also tend to avoid counting. I just finished reading Attack and Defense by Ishida and Davies. One thing that I learned is that when you’re behind, it’s time to make a risky, daring attack; when you’re ahead, it’s time to defensively solidify your lead. So I guess estimating the score is important.
